Container Properties

When you create or open a container, there are a large number of properties that you can specify which control various aspects of the container's behavior. The following are the properties commonly used by Figaro applications. For a complete listing of the properties available for use, see the ContainerConfig object in the API reference.

Property Description
AllowCreate Causes the container and all underlying databases to be created. It is not necessary to specify this property on the call to CreateContainer(ContainerConfig). In addition, you need to specify it for OpenContainer(ContainerConfig) only if the container has not already been created.
ExclusiveCreate Causes the container creation to fail if the container already exists. It is not necessary to specify this property on the call to CreateContainer(ContainerConfig). Note that this property is meaningless unless AllowCreate is also used.
ReadOnly The container is opened for read-only access.
AllowValidation Causes XML documents to be validated when they are loaded into the container. The default behavior is to not validate documents.
IndexNodes Determines whether indexes for the container will return nodes (if this property is set to On) or documents (if this property is set to Off). Note that the default index type is determined by the type of container you are creating. If you are creating a container of type NodeContainer, then this property is set to On by default. For containers of type WholeDocContainer, this property is set to Off by default. If you want to change this property on an existing container, you must re-index the container in order for the new index type to take effect. For more information on index nodes, see Using Indices.
Transactional The container supports transactions. For more information, see the Getting Started with Concurrent and Transactional Processing guide.
Note

This property is only available to Figaro Transactional Data Store (Figaro TDS) customers.
